title: Ticket #2867: condor_submit makes noise about final node variables
description:
The FINAL node feature implemented two variables, DAG_STATUS and FAILED_COUNT, which are appended to the .dagman.out file. This results in condor_submit registering a complaint about them; e.g., 
03/06/12 16:10:00 submitting: condor_submit -a dag_node_name' '=' '1 -a +DAGManJobId' '=' '60 -a DAGManJobId' '=' '60 -a submit_event_notes' '=' 'DAG' 'Node:' '1 -a DAG_STATUS' '=' '0 -a FAILED_COUNT' '=' '0 -a +DAGParentNodeNames' '=' '"" 1281.cmd
03/06/12 16:10:00 From submit: Submitting job(s).
03/06/12 16:10:00 From submit: 1 job(s) submitted to cluster 61.
03/06/12 16:10:00 From submit: WARNING: the line `dag_status = 0' was unused by condor_submit. Is it a typo?
03/06/12 16:10:00 From submit: WARNING: the line `failed_count = 0' was unused by condor_submit. Is it a typo?
Prefixing these attribute names with + fixes the clutter.
remarks:
2012-Mar-06 21:43:49 by nwp:
After I pushed this onto master, a bunch of dagman-final-* tests started failing, so I reverted it.

2012-Mar-07 11:05:41 by wenger:
Nathan, my initial thought on this is to change condor_submit to just not warn about those variables, rather than changing what DAGMan is doing.

At the minimum, if we change how DAGMan is passing along that information, we need to change the related documentation.

2012-Mar-29 11:16:29 by wenger:
This ticket is essentially a duplicate of #2814, so I'm going to resolve it.
check_ins:
2012-Mar-06 21:35   Check-in [30844]: Revert "DAGman log gets littered with innocuous noise" This reverts commit 11c42333347129b541093eec435d689eabcd49ec. A bunch of dagman tests fail with this commit, so I am reverting it This is for #2867 (By Nathan W. Panike )
2012-Mar-06 16:17   Check-in [30839]: DAGman log gets littered with innocuous noise The FINAL node feature introduced the variables DAG_STATUS and FAILED_COUNT. condor_submit then says it knows nothing about these variable. Let's clean this up. ===GT=== #2867 (By Nathan W. Panike )
creator: nwp
